Docs.param: The parameters identifying this job, as supplied to the job in the #onStartJob(JobParameters) callback.
true if this job should be rescheduled according to the back-off criteria specified when it was first scheduled; false otherwise.
Docs.summary: Call this to inform the JobScheduler that the job has finished its work.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: Parameters specifying info about this job, including the optional extras configured with JobInfo.Builder#setExtras(android.os.PersistableBundle). This object serves to identify this specific running job instance when calling #jobFinished(JobParameters, boolean).
Docs.summary: Called to indicate that the job has begun executing.
Docs.returns: true if your service will continue running, using a separate thread when appropriate. false means that this job has completed its work.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract bool OnStopJob (Android.App.Job.JobParameters? params);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool OnStopJob(class Android.App.Job.JobParameters params) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function OnStopJob (params As JobParameters) As Boolean
public: abstract bool OnStopJob(Android::App::Job::JobParameters ^ params);
abstract member OnStopJob : Android.App.Job.JobParameters -> bool

Docs.param: The parameters identifying this job, similar to what was supplied to the job in the #onStartJob(JobParameters) callback, but with the stop reason included.
Docs.summary: This method is called if the system has determined that you must stop execution of your job even before you've had a chance to call #jobFinished(JobParameters, boolean).
Docs.returns: true to indicate to the JobManager whether you'd like to reschedule this job based on the retry criteria provided at job creation-time; or false to end the job entirely. Regardless of the value returned, your job must stop executing.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
